item.title: Golang pointer detailed explanation
item.author: wzdushu@gmail.com (wanzi)
item.description: What is a pointer? In Go, a pointer is a variable that stores the memory address of another variable. Therefore, a pointer variable points to the memory address of another variable, not the variable itself. When declaring a pointer variable, you need to add * before the variable name to indicate that it is a pointer variable, for example: Copy 1 var p *int This means that a pointer named
